Intubation.QuestionsText: Which medication should be used in the RSI procedure?
What should your first action be?
Intubation.QuestText: The nurse is monitoring the patient and the secondary anesthesiologist is administering medication

Intubation.QuestionsText: What should be done with the used laryngoscope?
Intubation.OptionA: Place used laryngoscope in biohazard and remove outside gloves
Intubation.OptionB: Place used laryngoscope in a cassette bag and roll it up
Intubation.OptionC: Place used laryngoscope in the trash bin
Intubation.QuestText: OR nurse is inflating the ETT cuff

Intubation.QuestionsText: What should be done after the ETT cuff is inflated?
Intubation.OptionA: Connect circuit to iGel and apply PPV as usual
Intubation.OptionC: Lightly squeeze the cuff to ensure it is inflated properly
Intubation.OptionD: Connect circuit to ETT and apply PPV

Intubation.QuestionsText: What should be done once the circuit is connected to the ETT?
What should you use to cover the patient’s mouth with during extubation?
At what point during extubation should you place the blue cloth/towel over the patient’s mouth?
Intubation.OptionA: Before you inflate the ETT cuff
Intubation.OptionB: While you inflate the ETT cuff
Intubation.OptionC: After you inflate the ETT cuff

Intubation.QuestionsText: At what point during extubation should you disconnect the ETT from the circuit/HME filter?
Intubation.OptionA: When the SGA or ETT is still inside the mouth
Intubation.OptionB: Once the SGA or ETT is out of the mouth

Intubation.QuestionsText: Where should you dispose of the ETT tube and blue cloth/towel?
Intubation.OptionA: Hand all disposable items to the circulating nurse to dispose of
Intubation.OptionB: Place used ETT and cloth onto the anesthesia work station
Intubation.OptionC: In a trash bag attached to the head of the bed/or into a trash bin located right beside the head of the bed
Intubation.OptionD: In the trash bin located behind the ventilator/omnicell

Intubation.QuestionsText: Which equipment should NOT be thrown away, but kept in a sealed specimen bag?
